The aircraft from the 49 Regiment combat helicopters [[Pruszcz GdaÅski]] was on a night training flight for service in [[Afghanistan]] resulting in 2 crew injured and 1 fatality.<ref>http://www.tvn24.pl/0,10205,1593986,,,zawinil-czlowiek-lub-pogoda,raport_wiadomosc.html TVN24.pl ZawiniÅ czÅowiek lub pogoda KATASTROFA MI-24</ref> *19 March - A small [[Beechcraft]] military plane [[2009 Quito B200 King Air crash|crashes]] into an apartment building in [[Quito]], [[Ecuador]], killing five on board and two on the ground.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7954173.stm | work=BBC News | title=Ecuador plane crash kills seven | date=20 March 2009 | accessdate=8 May 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/americas/03/19/ecuador.plane/index.html | work=CNN | title=Ecuador: Seven die from Quito plane crash - CNN.com | date=20 March 2009 | accessdate=8 May 2010}}</ref> *23 March - A [[Bundeswehr]] [[Luftwaffe]] [[Panavia Tornado]] PA-200, ''45+37'', from ''[[Jagdbombergeschwader 33]]'' crashes on the runway at [[BÃ¼chel]] Air Force Base, [[Rhineland-Palatinate]], Germany. The aircraft, on a routine night training exercise, suffers extensive damage during the incident which occurs in high winds and rain, the two crew ejecting safely.<ref>http://www.n-tv.de/panorama/Tornado-in-Buechel-verunglueckt-article63202.html N-tv.de Ãberschlag bei Landeanflug Tornado in BÃ¼chel verunglÃ¼ckt</ref> *25 March - An [[USAF]] [[F-22 Raptor|F-22A Block 10 Raptor]], ''91-4008'', ''Raptor 07'', of the [[411th Flight Test Squadron]], [[412th Test Wing]], crashes in the marshy flat land 6 miles N of [[Harper Lake|Harper Dry Lake]] near [[Edwards Air Force Base]], California, during a weapons integration flight test mission.<ref>United States Air Force Aircraft Accident Investigation Board Report, Major General David W. Eidsaune, President, 15 July 2009, Executive Summary, page i.</ref> The single-seater goes down about 1000 hrs. (1300 hrs. ET) for unknown reasons, the officials said. The fighter was on a test mission when it crashed about {{convert|35|mi|km}} NE of Edwards AFB, where it was stationed, the Air Force said in a news release.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://cnnwire.blogs.cnn.com/2009/03/25/air-force-jet-crashes-in-california/ | work=CNN | title=Air Force jet crashes in California | accessdate=8 May 2010}}</ref> KWF was [[David P. Cooley|David Cooley]], 49, a 21-year Air Force veteran who joined [[Lockheed Martin Corp.]], the plane's principal contractor, in 2003. Cooley, of Palmdale, was pronounced dead at Victor Valley Community Hospital in [[Victorville, California]].<ref>Los Angeles Times, 26 March 2009, page 24.</ref> An Air Force investigation finds that the accident occurred after the pilot lost consciousness in a high-gravity maneuver. The reports stated that during the third test of the mission the pilot appeared to have been subjected to increased physiological stress and his lack of awareness delayed a recovery maneuver.<ref>Fort Walton Beach, Florida, "Air Force cites 'human factors' in crash", ''Northwest Florida Daily News'', Wednesday, 5 August 2009, Volume 63, Number 187, page A2.</ref> At 7,486 ft MSL, the pilot initiated ejection outside of the seat design envelope and immediately sustained fatal injuries.<ref>United States Air Force Aircraft Accident Investigation Board Report, Major General David W. Eidsaune, President, 15 July 2009, Executive Summary, page i.</ref><ref>http://www.airforce-magazine.com/SiteCollectionDocuments/Reports/2009/July%202009/Day31/F-22_AIB_073109.pdf</ref> *31 March - A [[Polish Air Force]] [[PZL M28]] (Antonov An-28TD Bryza 1TD) crashes into trees on final approach to an airfield near [[Gdynia]], Poland. The two crew members successfully eject from the aircraft and were hospitalized after the incident.<ref>http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/n.php?n=two-pilots-survive-military-plane-crash-in-turkey-2009-07-23</ref> *23 July - An [[Military of Uzbekistan|Uzbekistan Air Force]] [[Mil Moscow Helicopter Plant|Mil]] [[Mil Mi-24|Mi-24]] ''Hind'' [[Helicopter]] on a routine training exercise crashes near the airport of [[Chirchiq]], [[Tashkent Province]], [[Uzbekistan]] killing the 2 crew.<ref>http://www.zakon.kz/143898-pod-tashkentom-razbilsja-vertolet-vvs.html Zakon.kz - ÐÐ¾Ð´ Ð¢Ð°ÑÐºÐµÐ½ÑÐ¾Ð¼ ÑÐ°Ð·Ð±Ð¸Ð»ÑÑ Ð²ÐµÑÑÐ¾Ð»ÐµÑ ÐÐÐ¡ Ð£Ð·Ð±ÐµÐºÐ¸ÑÑÐ°Ð½Ð°</ref> *31 July - An [[Indian Air Force]] [[HAL HPT-32 Deepak]] a prop-driven primary military trainer crashes in the Medak district of the [[Andhra Pradesh]] state killing the 2 crew.<ref>http://www.nation.com.pk/pakistan-news-newspaper-daily-english-online/Politics/01-Aug-2009/2-pilots-die-in-Indian-military-plane-crash</ref> *5 August - A [[Pakistan Air Force]] [[Chengdu J-7|Chengdu FT-7]] crashes near [[Attock]], northwest Pakistan, killing the pilot.<ref name="Scramble364-76">Scramble Issue 364 page 76.</ref> *6 August - A [[Swedish Air Force]] [[Saab]] [[JAS 39 Gripen|JAS 39 Gripen C]] from [[F 17 Kallinge]] Blekinge Air Force Wing suffered a heavy landing at [[Ronneby Airport]], Sweden caused by the failure of the under-carriage to operate after a fire alarm was trigged and the pilot was uninjured in the incident.<ref>http://www.mil.se/sv/Forband-och-formagor/Forband/Blekinge-flygflottilj-F-17/Nyheter/JAS-plan-i-olycka/ JAS 39-plan i olycka - En JAS 39C buklandade kort efter 14.00 pÃ¥ flygflottiljen F 17 i Ronneby</ref> *16 August - Two [[Russian Knights]] air display [[Su-27]] jets '''[[2009 Russia Sukhoi Su-27 mid-air collision|collided]]''' whilst training, killing one pilot, Igor Tkachenko, and injuring several civilians on the ground. The accident occurred 400 ft below the summit of the 14,421 feet high (4,268 m) [[Mount Massive]] in the [[Sawatch Range]], [[Colorado]] leaving 2 crew dead, 1 injured and 1 crew member missing.<ref>http://www.turkishweekly.net/news/87254/-2-dead-in-military-chopper-crash-on-colorado-mountain-update-.html</ref> *21 August - An [[Indian Navy]] [[BAE Sea Harrier]] crashes shortly after take-off from [[Dabolim Airport]] near [[Goa]], India. Cdr.]] Saurav Saxena.<ref>http://www.hindustantimes.com/homepage/goa/Pilot-killed-in-Indian-Navy-Sea-Harrier-crash/446891/H1-Article1-445549.aspx</ref> *27 August - A [[Hellenic Air Force]] [[PZL-Mielec M-18 Dromader]] fire-fighting aircraft from the 359 Public Services Air Support Unit based at [[Andravida AB|Andravida Airforce Base]] crashes after hitting high-voltage cables. Due to a fire the aircraft was damaged and the crew of 32 were safely evacuated and the fire extinguished by Nellis AFB emergency response crew.<ref>http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2009/aug/29/air-force-plane-damaged-while-landing-nellis/</ref> *30 August - A [[Belarusian Air Force]] [[Sukhoi]] [[Su-27]] Flanker was lost during [[Radom Air Show|Radom Airshow 2009]], Poland. The incident occurred in the Mediterranean of the coast of [[Perpignan]], [[PyrÃ©nÃ©es-Orientales]], France and one pilot was rescued after ejecting from the aircraft the second pilot listed as missing.<ref>http://www.france24.com/en/20090925-rafale-jet-crash-likely-caused-mid-air-collision-french-military-mediterranean-pilot France24.com French Navy Dassault Rafale collision Eastern Med Sep 2009</ref> *28 September - A [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]] (JMSDF) [[Nihon Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation|NAMC]] [[NAMC YS-11|YS-11]] a twin-engined [[turboprop]] transport crashed while landing at JMSDF [[Ozuki Air Field]] in [[Shimonoseki, Yamaguchi|Shimonoseki]], [[Yamaguchi Prefecture]], Japan. The landing in light rain, the aircraft suffered an overshoot of the runway and crashed through the airfield perimeter fence, crossing a service road and plunged nose-first into a rice field. The 11 JMSDF crew members of the aircraft were uninjured and the NAMC YS-11 aircraft suffered bent propellers. *2 October - A [[Yemeni Air Force]] [[Mikoyan|Mikoyan-Gurevich]] [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21|MiG-21]] ''Fishbed'' crashes during a low-flying exercise due to mechanical failure.<ref>http://www.saudigazette.com.sa/index.cfm?method=home.regcon&contentID=2009100350561 Saudi Gazette Yemeni Mig Crash</ref><ref>http://derstandard.at/fs/1254310474474/Kampfflugzeug-abgestuerzt Kampfflugzeug abgestÃ¼rzt</ref> *2 October - A [[Mexican Air Force|Fuerza AÃ©rea Mexicana]] [[Cessna]] [[Cessna 182|182S Skylane]] (''FAM-5498'') crashes near San JosÃ© Querendaro, [[MichoacÃ¡n]], Mexico. The aircraft on a reconnaissance flight from [[Morelia]] Airport crashed in the mountains of MichoacÃ¡n with 3 crew fatalities.<ref>http://www.sedena.gob.mx/index.php?id_art=2570 SecretarÃ­a de la Defensa Nacional - SE DESPLOMA AERONAVE DE LA FUERZA AÃREA MEXICANA EN EL ESTADO DE MICHOACÃN</ref> *3 October - A [[Military of Bolivia|Fuerza AÃ©rea Boliviano]] [[AÃ©rospatiale]] [[AÃ©rospatiale Lama|SA 315B Lama]] [[Helicopter]] (''FAB-730'') from the EscuadrÃ³n 511 crashes into a building wall on the [[Pampa]] near the city of [[Cochabamba]], [[Bolivia]] leaving 4 crew dead, 1 crew member injured and 1 civilian on the ground injured.<ref>http://www.elmundo.com.bo/Secundarianew.asp?edicion=29/06/2007&Tipo=Policial&Cod=5799 El Mundo.com Cuatro militares mueren al estrellarse helicÃ³ptero de la FAB</ref> *7 October - A [[Libyan Air Force]] [[Mikoyan|Mikoyan-Gurevich]] [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-23|MiG-23]] ''Flogger'' crashes while taking part during an airshow for the Third Libyan Aviation Exhibition, LAVEX 2009 held at [[Mitiga International Airport]], [[Tripoli]], [[Libya]]. The aircraft travelling at low-level hit a one-storey house in the suburb of Souq Al-Jumaa in Tripoli killing the 2 crew and injuring two civilians.<ref>http://www.tripolipost.com/articledetail.asp?c=1&i=3654# The Tripoli Post - Mig-23 Fighter Jet Crashes in Tripoli Suburb, Two Pilots Killed</ref> *9 October - A [[Uruguayan Air Force|Fuerza AÃ©rea Uruguaya]] [[EADS CASA]] [[CASA C-212 Aviocar|C-212-200 Aviocar]] (''FAU-531/UN-146'') a twin-engined [[turboprop]] transport aircraft, on a reconnaissance flight crashes near [[Fonds-Verrettes]], [[Ouest Department]], [[Haiti]]. The aircraft taking part in the [[United Nations Stabilization Mission in Haiti]] crashed into a mountainside near the remote village of Pays-Pourri killing the 11 crew.<ref>http://www.fau.com.uy/fallecidos_fau531.html Accidente aÃ©reo en la Fuerza AÃ©rea Uruguaya</ref> *12 October - An [[Irish Air Corps]] [[Pilatus Aircraft|Pilatus]] [[Pilatus PC-9|PC-9 M]] flying in poor weather conditions crashes at Crumlin East near [[Cornamona]] in [[County Galway]], [[Republic of Ireland]] killing the flying instructor and cadet pilot.<ref>http://www.rte.ie/news/2009/1012/cornamona.html RTÃ News - Two feared dead after Air Corps crash</ref> *15 October - An [[United States Air Force]] [[Lockheed Martin]] [[F-16 Fighting Falcon|F-16C Block 50D Fighting Falcon]], ''91-0365'', is lost while flying on a routine night flying exercise from the [[77th Fighter Squadron]], [[20th Fighter Wing]], based at the [[Shaw Air Force Base]], [[Sumter, South Carolina]] when it collides mid-air with F-16C Block 50D Fighting Falcon, ''91-0364''.<ref name="ReferenceB"/> The two aircraft from the 20th Fighter Wing were training with night vision equipment and practising combat tactics when the accident occurred {{convert|40|mi|km}} east of [[Folly Beach, South Carolina]] at ~2030 hrs. The [[United States Coast Guard]] commenced a search for a missing aircraft in the [[North Atlantic]] of the coast of South Carolina while the second aircraft, piloted by Capt. Lee Bryant, despite damage was able to land at [[Charleston Air Force Base]].<ref>http://www.wtoctv.com/Global/story.asp?S=11324477 WTOC TV Savannah Georgia - Debris found during search for missing F-16 pilot</ref> on 16 October, Coast Guard searchers found crash debris in the Atlantic Ocean believed to belong to the missing F-16. "The Coast Guard has found some debris in the ocean that is apparently from our missing F-16", said Robert Sexton, the Shaw Air Force Base Public Affairs chief in Sumter, South Carolina The other pilot, Capt. Nicholas Giglio, is missing. "They have not yet found any sign of the pilot and the search continues", Mr. Sexton said. No one witnessed what happened to Captain Giglio after the collision.<ref>http://www.af.mil/news/story.asp?id=123173189</ref> *17 October - An [[United States Marine Corps]] [[McDonnell Douglas]] [[F/A-18 Hornet]] [[F/A-18 Hornet#Specifications_.28F.2FA-18C.2FD.29|D]] (''164729'') from the Marine All Weather Fighter Attack Squadron No. 224 [[VMFA(AW)-224]] based at the [[Marine Corps Air Station Beaufort]], [[Beaufort, South Carolina]] experiences a heavy landing at [[Jacksonville International Airport]], [[Duval County, Florida]]. The aircraft with two other Marine F/A-18 Hornet aircraft were landing at Jacksonville Airport in preparation for a flyover at the nearby [[National Football League|NFL]] [[Jacksonville Jaguars]] game when the aircraft experiences an airborne technical fault and the port landing-gear collapses causing the aircraft to land only on the nose-wheel, starboard undercarriage and the exposed port-side external fuel-tank. The F/A-18 Hornet skidded down the runway with most damage occurring to the grounded external fuel-tank and the 2 Marine crew were uninjured.<ref>http://www.miamiherald.com/news/florida/AP/story/1288592.html Miami Herald - 2 pilots OK after fighter jet's rocky landing</ref> *22 October - An [[United States Army]] [[Sikorsky Aircraft|Sikorsky]] [[UH-60 Black Hawk]] [[Helicopter]] while on a routine training exercise crashes onto the deck of the [[USNS Arctic (T-AOE-8)|USNS Arctic]] off the coast of [[Fort Story]], [[Virginia Beach]], [[Virginia]]. The Black Hawk helicopter from the [[160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment (United States)|160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment (Airborne)]] was on a joint exercise with the [[United States Navy SEALs]] and was practising fast maritime interdiction by [[Abseiling|rappelling]] by rope to the ships deck when the accident occurred killing 1 crew and injuring a further 8 service personnel.<ref>http://www.nypost.com/p/news/national/dead_hurt_in_helicopter_crash_on_2xntrqrdzAh43tYU6d591K New York Post - 1 dead, 8 hurt in helicopter crash on Navy ship</ref> *23 October - An [[Indian Air Force]] [[Mikoyan|Mikoyan-Gurevich]] [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-27|MiG-27]] ''Flogger D/J'' flying from the [[Hasimara]] Air Force Base, [[Eastern Air Command, Indian Air Force|Eastern Air Command]] crashes near [[New Jalpaiguri]], [[West Bengal]], India. The aircraft on a routine training exercise suffers a technical fault and an on-board engine fire shortly after take-off. After a successful ejection the pilot parachutes into a nearby tea estate and the aircraft crashes into a nearby river bank injuring two children.<ref>http://24dunia.com/english-news/topheadlines-news/showgroup/4257922.html Hindustan Times - MiG-27 crash: Pilot survives, children suffer burns</ref> *29 October - A [[Brazilian Air Force|ForÃ§a AÃ©rea Brasileira]] [[Cessna]] [[Cessna 208|208]] C-98/U-27 Caravan 1 '' FAB-2725'' flying from [[Cruzeiro do Sul, Acre]] to [[Tabatinga]] crash lands in the [[ItuÃ­ River]] a small tributary of the Rio Javari, [[Amazonas (Brazilian state)|Amazonas]] State. The twin-engined turboprop aircraft of the 7Âº EsquadrÃ£o de Transporte AÃ©reo from Base AÃ©rea de Manaus was transporting officials from Brazilian Ministry of Health participating in a vaccination programme when the aircraft crashed landed between the Amazonian villages of Aurelius and New River. The aircraft was later found by indigenous villagers of the region discovering 9 survivors and 2 dead crew.<ref>http://www.fab.mil.br/portal/capa/index.php?datan=31/10/2009&page=mostra_notimpol FAB Os nove sobreviventes de acidente com aviÃ£o da FAB foram levados para hospital no Acre</ref> *30 October - An [[United States Coast Guard]] [[Lockheed C-130 Hercules]] from USCG Air Station Sacramento, CA collided with an [[United States Marine Corps]] [[Bell AH-1 SuperCobra]] Attack Helicopter {{convert|15|mi|km}} off of the coast of Southern California, killing all seven Coast aircrew and both Marine aircrew. *6 November - A [[Russian Naval Aviation]] [[Tupolev]] [[Tupolev Tu-142|Tu-142 M3]] ''Bear F/J'' from the 310th Independent Long Range Anti-Submarine Aviation Regiment based at [[Kamenny Ruchey]] Airbase crashes 15â20 km from the coast of Cape Datta north of [[Sovetskaya Gavan]]. The Naval aircraft on a routine training exercise crashes into the sea in the [[Strait of Tartary|Tatar Straight]] near the island of [[Sakhalin]] with the loss of all 11 crew.<ref>http://www.newsru.com/russia/07nov2009/tu.html News Russia.com Ð¢Ð°ÑÐ°ÑÑÐºÐ¾Ð¼ Ð¿ÑÐ¾Ð»Ð¸Ð²Ðµ Ð¸ÑÑÑ ÑÐºÐ¸Ð¿Ð°Ð¶ ÑÐ¿Ð°Ð²ÑÐµÐ³Ð¾ Ð¢Ñ-142</ref> *24 November - An Italian Air Force transport plane [[C-130J]] engaged in a training mission crashed nearby train tracks bordering the Pisa airport, while climbing and performing a left turn immediately after take-off. The aircraft immediately burst into flames, killing its five-member crew.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://beta.thehindu.com/news/international/article53807.ece | location=Chennai, India | work=The Hindu | title=Italian military plane crashes, 5 dead | date=24 November 2009}}</ref> *27 November - A [[Sri Lanka Air Force]] [[Mil Moscow Helicopter Plant|Mil]] [[Mil Mi-24|Mi-24]] ''Hind'' [[Helicopter]] (CH635, c/n 3532431622597) engaged on a training mission, crashed 5 km north of Buttala(310 km south-east of Colombo) at approximately 1330 HRS due to technical failure. Prior to the crash the pilot have reported a power generator failure to the tail rotor. Pilot, Co-Pilot and 2 door gunners have died from this incident.<ref>http://news.armoks.com/air-force-helicopter-crashes-in-sri-lanka/28598/</ref> *30 November - An [[Indian Air Force]] [[Su-30MKI]] crashes near Jethagaon in Jaisalmer of Rajasthan after it took off from Jodhpur, crash happened while returning from a regular training mission, both pilots are safe.<ref>http://www.indianexpress.com/news/HAL-made-Sukhoi-crashes/548279</ref> *8 December - A [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]] [[Sikorsky Aircraft|Sikorsky]] [[SH-60 Seahawk|HH-60H Seahawk]] [[Helicopter]] crashed and sank off the coast of Nagasaki. Two crewmembers were killed, while a third was rescued.<ref>http://www.japantoday.com/category/national/view/2-bodies-found-after- msdf-helicopter-crash</ref> *16 December - [[Pakistan Air Force]] [[Dassault Mirage III]] fighter aircraft crashed during a training mission due to a technical fault. The pilot managed to eject safely, landing in the Durrab Lake, (Kallar Kahar) and was rescued by a boat. *23 December - [[Thai Air Force]] [[Northrop F-5]]E (211 Sq. coded 21118/91681) fighter aircraft crashed in Thailand. Pilot Chatchawan Rassamee died.<ref>http://www.nzz.ch/nachrichten/panorama/thailand_kampfflugzeug_1.4328124.html</ref>
==2010== * 13 January - A [[Yemeni Air Force]] [[Aero L-39 Albatros]] training aircraft crashed in the area of Salah al-Din, west of the port city of Aden due to a technical problem. Pilot survived.<ref>http://news.ninemsn.com.au/article.aspx?id=999436</ref> * 14 January - A [[Russian Air Force]] [[Sukhoi Su-27]] crashes near Komsomolsk on Amur. Pilot killed.<ref>http://www.newsru.com/russia/16jan2010/kray.html</ref> * 14 January - A [[Royal New Zealand Air Force]] CT4 Airtrainer crashes near Ohakea, New Zealand while performing routine aerobatic training. Pilot, Sqn Ldr Nick Cree, killed.<ref name="TVNZ_3330170">{{cite news |url=http://tvnz.co.nz/national-news/pilot-killed-in-air-force-crash-named-3330170 |title=Pilot killed in Air Force crash named |date=14 January 2010 |work=[[Television New Zealand]] |agency=[[Newstalk ZB]]/ [[NZPA]] |accessdate=14 October 2011}}</ref> * 21 January - A [[Sociedad de Salvamento y Seguridad MarÃ­tima]] [[AgustaWestland AW139]] helicopter fell into the sea off AlmerÃ­a. Three people are missing.<ref name="Stuff.co.nz_3259311">{{cite news |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/world/3259311/NZ-pilots-body-found-after-helicopter-crash |title=NZ pilot's body found after helicopter crash |date=25 January 2010 |work=[[Stuff.co.nz]] |accessdate=14 October 2011}}</ref> * 22 January - A [[Myanmar Air Force]] [[Chengdu J-7|F-7]] fighter crashed while attempting to land at Yangon airport, killing its pilot.<ref>http://theasiandefence.blogspot.com/2010/01/myanmar-air-force-f-7-jet-crashes.html</ref> * 23 January - A [[United States Navy]] T-34C Turbomentor, an upgraded version of the [[T-34 Mentor]], crash-landed in [[Lake Pontchartrain]] near [[New Orleans]]. One pilot was rescued and the other was missing.<ref>[http://forums.liveleak.com/showthread.php?p=779173 US Navy T-34 crash. One pilot found, one missing]</ref> The plane, on a routine nighttime instrument training mission, crashed about 1845 hrs. and was {{convert|1|nmi|km|adj=on}} north of [[Lakefront Airport]] in New Orleans on an apparent approach to land. [[Coast Guard]] teams rescued the student pilot about 9 p.m. with mild hypothermia and moderate injuries from the 57 degree water. The pilot, Lt. Clinton Wermers, 33, from [[Mitchell, South Dakota]], was presumed dead. He had been assigned to [[Naval Air Station Whiting Field]] since March 2007.<ref>Florida Freedom Newspapers, "Whiting Field pilot presumed dead in Louisiana crash", Northwest Florida Daily News, Fort Walton Beach, Florida, 26 January 2010, p. A1.</ref> A memorial service was held for Lt. Wermers on 1 February at Whiting Field.<ref>Florida Freedom Newspapers, "Mourners honor fallen serviceman", Northwest Florida Daily News, Fort Walton Beach, Florida, 2 February 2010, p. A3</ref> * 24 January - A [[Finnish Air Force]] [[F-18]] Hornet crashed in the south of the country. The fighter crashed in Juuapajoki, north of the southern city of Tampere at about 11:50 local time. The two pilots, who were on a routine training flight, ejected safely and were uninjured.<ref>http://english.people.com.cn/90001/90777/90853/6875773.html</ref> * 26 January - A [[Nigerian Navy]] [[AgustaWestland AW109|AgustaWestland AW109E]] helicopter crashed in south Nigeria. The accident happened at about 01:30 p.m. (1330 GMT) when the helicopter was returning from a routine patrol of Port-Harcourt area in the Niger-Delta region. Four people were killed.<ref>http://english.people.com.cn/90001/90777/90855/6879952.html</ref> * 3 February - [[Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk]] [[United States Army]]-helicopter crashed in Germany about 1800 hrs. local time northeast of Mannheim, killing three people on board.<ref>http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2010/02/03/US-Army-copter-crashes-in-Germany-3-die/UPI-76081265245951/</ref> * 5 February - [[UH-1_Iroquois_variants#UH-1H|UH-1H Iroquois]] [[Brazilian Air Force]] helicopter crashed in Campo Grande.<ref>http://www.campogrande.news.com.br/canais/view/?canal=8&id=281518</ref> * 9 February - [[Bell AH-1 Cobra]] [[Pakistan Air Force]] gunship helicopter has crashed in the Teera Valley in Pakistan's Khyber tribal area near the Afghanistan's border. Pilot survived.<ref>http://www.aeronautica.difesa.it/News/Pagine/F16cadutoinmare.aspx</ref> * 14 February - A [[Yemeni Air Force]] [[Mil Mi-17]] [[Helicopter]] crashes in the Kahlan district, east of the provincial capital Saada. The helicopter's four-man crew and the seven wounded soldiers they were evacuating all died, as did two soldiers in a military vehicle which the aircraft crashed into.<ref>http://business.maktoob.com/20090000435614/Death_toll_in_Yemen_chopper_crash_rises_to_13/Article.htm</ref> * 16 February - An [[Indian Air Force]] [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-27]] fighter went down near Siliguri in West Bengal killing the pilot, a squadron leader.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Pilot-killed-in-MiG-27-crash-/articleshow/5581367.cms | work=The Times Of India | title=Pilot killed in MiG-27 crash | date=17 February 2010}}</ref> * 18 February - [[Sikorsky SH-60 Seahawk|Sikorsky MH-60S Seahawk]] [[United States Navy]]-helicopter crashed in West Virginia outside of Lewisburg. Passengers and crew sustained unspecified injuries, none of which are life-threatening.<ref>http://wowktv.com/story.cfm?func=viewstory&storyid=75427</ref> * 18 February - An [[Indian Air Force]] [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21]] fighter jet (8th Squadron, 20th Wing) crashed soon after take-off from Bagdora in West Bengal but the pilot ejected to safety.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/IAF-MiG-21-crashes-in-West-Bengal-pilot-safe-/articleshow/5593107.cms | work=The Times Of India | title=IAF MiG-21 crashes in West Bengal, pilot safe | date=19 February 2010}}</ref> * 21 February - [[United States Army]] [[Bell OH-58 Kiowa]] helicopter made a "hard landing" in northern Iraq killing the two pilots on board.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/US-military-2-US-helicopter-pilots-killed-in-Iraq-/articleshow/5601047.cms | work=The Times Of India | title=US military: 2 US helicopter pilots killed in Iraq | deadurl=yes}} {{Dead link|date=April 2011|bot=RjwilmsiBot}}</ref> * 24 February - A [[Mexican Air Force|Fuerza AÃ©rea Mexicana]] [[Cessna 182|Cessna 182S Skylane]] crashed during take off near San Diego de AlcalÃ¡, Chihuahua, 3 injured, 2 fatalities.<ref>http://www.segundoasegundo.com/html/43027_0_1_0_C.html</ref> * 24 February - A [[Philippine Air Force]] [[North American OV-10 Bronco]] crashed during training at 1455 hrs. Two Philippine Air Force pilots were killed.<ref>http://www.tribune.net.ph/headlines/20100225hed2.html</ref> * 25 February - An [[United States Air Force]] [[General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon|F-16C Fighting Falcon]] crashed during landing at Osan Air Base, South Korea.22-year-old plane became uncontrollable and the pilot bailed out. Also at least 5 other civilians received injuries.</ref> * 3 March - A [[Azerbaijan Air Force]] [[Sukhoi Su-25]] close air support aircraft crashed in the Shamkir district in northwest Azerbaijan at ~1700 hrs. local time, killing the pilot.<ref>http://en.rian.ru/exsoviet/20100303/158080923.html</ref> * 3 March - An [[Republic of Korea Army]] [[MD Helicopters MD 500]] helicopter crashed 20 km east of the capital Seoul, at ~2014 hrs. The two crew members were rushed to a hospital but were later confirmed dead.<ref>http://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/restofasia/SKorean-military-chopper-crashes-2-pilots-killed/Article1-514888.aspx</ref> * 3 March - A [[Coast Guard]] MH-60T, an upgraded [[Sikorsky HH-60 Jayhawk]] helicopter crashed in the remote Utah mountains. The helicopters made a refueling stop in [[Salt Lake City]] and were headed to [[Leadville, Colorado]], when the crash occurred about {{convert|50|mi|km}} east of Salt Lake City. Three crewmen were airlifted to local hospitals and two others sustained minor injuries.<ref>Associated Press, "Coast Guard helicopter crashes in mountains", Northwest Florida Daily News, Fort Walton Beach, Florida, Thursday, 4 March 2010, p. A2.</ref> * 10 March - A [[Brazilian Army]] [[Eurocopter Fennec]] helicopter crashed During a night training flight during Operation CaburÃ©. All four crew members died.<ref>http://www.cidadebranca.com.br/contents.php?CID=78935</ref> * 10 March - A [[United States Marine Corps]] [[F/A-18D Hornet]], BuNo ''164694'', 'WK-01', from [[VMFA(AW)-224]] crashed into the Atlantic Ocean, app. {{convert|35|mi|km}} east of St. Helena Sound, South Carolina, after a double engine failure and a fire. Both pilots ejected and were floating in an inflatable life raft for about one hour before they were rescued by a USCG helicopter.<ref>http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5h8Ycl2CSWZMDDu_jgIJhD4hWm-8QD9ECG7GO0</ref> * 11 March - A [[Mil Mi-8]] helicopter Kazakhstan The Ministry of Emergency Situations crashed for unknown reasons during rescue flight in blizzard.<ref>http://www.velozia.com/?p=2959</ref> * 15 March - Two [[United States Navy]] [[F/A-18E Super Hornet]]s from [[VFA-122]] collided in mid-air at 2200 hrs., sending one crashing to the Nevada desert. Aircraft crashed on the airfield and was destroyed. The second aircraft landed safely in Heraklion Airport.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/lincolnshire/8583263.stm | work=BBC News | title=Red Arrows in mid-air collision | date=23 March 2010 | accessdate=8 May 2010}}</ref> * 25 March - A [[Royal Malaysian Air Force]] [[Pilatus PC-7]].Crashed during airshow near local university campus. Pilot bailed at low altitude but was killed.<ref>http://www.thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2010/3/26/nation/5935143&sec=nation=nation</ref> * 25 March - A [[Chilean Army]] [[MD_Helicopters_MD_500#MD_530F|MD Helicopters 530F]] The helicopter was on a mission in the region that was badly damaged by the last earthquake. The helicopter suffered an engine failure shortly after takeoff after disembarking a passenger and crashed. All 4 crew member were taken to the hospital, three of them with serious injuries.<ref>http://latercera.com/contenido/680_236903_9.shtml</ref> * 29 March - [[Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk]] [[United States Army]]-helicopter crashed in Forward Operating Base Atgar in the Zabul province of Afghanistan.<ref>http://www.velozia.com/?p=3195&utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+VeloziaAir+%28Velozia+Air%29&utm_content=Google+Reader</ref> * 31 March - [[Grumman E-2 Hawkeye]] [[United States Navy]] craft from Carrier Airborne Early Warning Squadron 121 crashed at approximately 1400 hrs. local time in Arabian Sea. Navy 5th Fleet officials declined to speculate on the cause of the crash, but the Naval Safety Centerâs Web site listed it as âan engine oil leak.â<ref name="Tilghman, Andrew 2010"/><ref name="navytimes.com"/> * 2 April - [[Embraer EMB 312 Tucano]] [[Brazilian Air Force]] aircraft from the Brazilian Air Force "Smoke Squadron" crashed during an airshow at the Aeroporto Federal de Lages. The pilot, aged 33, died in the crash.<ref>http://aviation-safety.net/wikibase/wiki.php?id=73764</ref> * 8 April - [[MFI-17 Mushshak]] [[Pakistan Army]] crashed in an open field, Nelavia area, near Peshawar's suburbs of Tagman.<ref>http://thenews.jang.com.pk/updates.asp?id=102413</ref> * 8 April - [[Dassault Mirage F1]] [[French Air Force]] The aircraft was conducting the basic training of Rheims when it crashed about 1140 hrs. in a field near a highway, four miles (6 km) from the base of OrlÃ©ans.<ref>http://www.lepoint.fr/actualites-societe/2010-04-08/un-mirage-f1-s-ecrase-pres-d-orleans-sans-faire-de-victime/920/0/442297</ref> * 9 April - One soldier killed.<ref>http://www.military.com/news/article/soldier-killed-in-iraq-black-hawk-crash.html</ref> * 20 April- While performing maneuvers, a [[Vertical de AviaciÃ³n]] [[Bell 222]]UT helicopter, registered ''HK-3262'', and a [[Fuerza AÃ©rea de Colombia]] (Colombian Air Force) [[MD Helicopters/Hughes 500/530]] crashed on a military garrison near [[Chaparral, Tolima]], Colombia.<ref>http://airflightdisaster.com/?p=9445</ref> * 20 April - [[HH-65 Dolphin]] US [[Coast Guard]] crashed into the {{convert|50|ft|m|adj=on}}-deep water in [[Lake Huron]], and sank nine miles (14 km) north of [[Port Huron]], Michigan.<ref>http://m.freep.com/news.jsp?key=637744&rc=lo</ref> * 21 April - Two [[Mikoyan MiG-29]] [[Belarusian Air Force]] fighter jets collided during a training flight. Jonathan Shively, Jr, 33, of [[Jamestown, South Carolina|Jamestown]], died of injuries, but second pilot, Chief Warrant Officer Roger Carpenter, 46, of [[Spartanburg, South Carolina|Spartanburg]], was in stable condition.<ref>http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2010/05/03/Military-helicopter-crash-probed-in-SC/UPI-86271272924852/</ref><ref>http://www.thestate.com/2010/05/02/1270184/mcentire-pilot-dies-in-copter.html</ref> * 10 May [[Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk]] [[United States Army]] helicopter made a controlled landing after being hit by enemy fire in Helmand Province . Pilot ejected safely.<ref>http://aviation-safety.net/wikibase/wiki.php?id=74272</ref> * 11 May [[Dassault Mirage 2000]] [[French Air Force]] crashed in a forest of Bougue close to Villeneuve-de-Marsan (Landes, Aquitaine), 6 km east of Mont de Marsan AB (LFBM) ,after technical problems. The helicopter [[autorotate]]d to impact and both occupants escaped unhurt.<ref>http://translate.google.com/translate?js=y&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&layout=1&eotf=1&u=http://www.corriereadriatico.it/articolo.php%3Fid%3D101599&sl=it&tl=en</ref> * 21 May - A [[U.S. Navy]] [[Lockheed P-3 Orion]] accidentally released a sonobuoy shortly after departure from [[NAS Jacksonville]], Florida, which fell {{convert|500|ft|m}} and crashed through the roof of a home in [[Mandarin, Florida]], coming to rest in a bedroom next to a bed. Resident Marwan Saman said his daughter had just gotten out of that bed about a half hour earlier. The Navy sent an explosives demolition team to retrieve the {{convert|3|ft|m|adj=on}}-long, 40-pound cylinder. No injuries were reported, and the Navy was making arrangements to pay for the damage. A malfunctioning launch tube was theorized for the drop.<ref>http://www.nwfdailynews.com/news/navy-29329-bouy-drops.html</ref> * 7 July - A [[United States Coast Guard]] MH-60J crashed off of [[La Push, Washington]] apparently after clipping power lines.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/localnews/2012301842_coptercrash08m.html | work=The Seattle Times | title=3 dead in Coast Guard copter crash off La Push | date=7 July 2010}}</ref> * 19 July - [[Philippine Air Force]] [[SIAI S-211]] ''09005'' crashed during a training flight in the Philippines, crew ejected OK.<ref name="scramble375-76">Scramble #375 p. 76</ref> * 23 July - A [[Canadian Forces]] [[CF-18 Hornet]], ''188738'', of [[419 Moose Squadron]], based at [[Cold Lake (Alberta)|Cold Lake]], crashed at [[Lethbridge County Airport]] during a low-speed, low-altitude practice run for the [[Alberta International Airshow]], the pilot Capt. Brian Bews, 36, ejected in a [[Martin-Baker]] seat seconds before the fighter fell off on its starboard wing and impacted on the airfield. He suffered a compression fracture in three vertebrae but is expected to fully recover.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.cbc.ca/canada/edmonton/story/2010/07/26/lethbridge-cf18-crash-bews-pilot-statement-alberta.html | work=CBC News | title=CF-18 crash pilot applauds ejection seat | date=26 July 2010}}</ref><ref>http://www.calgaryherald.com/business/energy-resources/crashes+burns+Lethbridge+airport/3315226/story.html</ref> * 26 July - An [[Israeli Air Force|Israeli Air Force (IAF)]] [[Sikorsky Aircraft|Sikorsky]] [[CH-53 Sea Stallion]] helicopter crashed during a joint Israeli-Romanian aviation exercise in the [[Carpathian Mountains]] in northern [[Romania]], killing six IAF officers and one [[Romanian Air Force]] officer.<ref>{{cite news|title=Netanyahu: Romania helicopter crash is an immense tragedy|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/netanyahu-romania-helicopter-crash-is-an-immense-tragedy-1.304236?localLinksEnabled=false|author=Anshel Pfeffer, Haaretz Service and News Agencies|date=July 26, 2010|work=Haaretz|accessdate=4 August 2010}}</ref> * 28 July A [[United States Air Force]] [[Boeing C-17 Globemaster III|Boeing C-17A Globemaster III]], ''00-0173'', ''Spirit of the Aleutians'', on a training mission crashed at ~1814 hrs. into a wooded area on [[Elmendorf Air Force Base]] in [[Anchorage, Alaska]] killing 3 members of the [[Alaska Air National Guard]] and 1 member of the [[US Air Force]]. The cause of the accident is under investigation.<ref>{{Cite news | title=Four Dead in Alaska Air Force Base Crash | accessdate=2010-07-29 | publisher=cbsnews.com | url =http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2010/07/29/national/main6723212.shtml?tag=stack | date=29 July 2010 | deadurl=yes}} {{Dead link|date=December 2011|bot=RjwilmsiBot}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news | title=Four confirmed dead in Elmendorf plane crash | accessdate=2010-07-29 | publisher=Anchorage Daily News adn.com | url =http://www.adn.com/2010/07/28/1385727/cargo-plane-reported-down-on-base.html}}</ref> This is apparently the first C-17 accident to result in the loss of life.<ref>http://www.adn.com/2010/07/28/1385727/cargo-plane-reported-down-on-base.html</ref> The crash damaged tracks of the [[Alaska Railroad]], which temporarily suspended operations in the area of the accident.<ref>http://www.adn.com/2010/07/29/1387215/fatal-c-17-crash-also-damaged.html</ref> * 28 July - An [[Iraqi Air Force]] Mil Mi-17 crashed in a sandstorm south-west of Baghdad, five killed.<ref name="scramble375-79" /> * 30 July - A Hellenic Army Boeing AH-64DHA Longbow on a test flight crashed at Megara Air Force Base, Greece, two killed.<ref name="scramble375-79">Scramble #375 p. 79</ref> * 24 August - A [[Spanish Air Force]] [[Eurofighter]] fighter crashed while attempting to take off at Moron Air Base, a Lieutenant Colonel of the Royal Saudi Air Force were killed while a Spanish Air Force Commander bail out exitously. * 10 November - An [[Indian Air Force]] [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-27]] fighter went down near [[Jodhpur]] in [[Rajasthan]] shortly after take off for a routine sortie, but the pilot bailed out safely.<ref>{{cite web | title = MiG-27 crashes near Jodhpur, pilot safe |publisher = Ibnlive.in.com | url = http://ibnlive.in.com/news/mig27-crashes-near-jodhpur-pilot-safe/134747-3.html?from=tn| accessdate = Nov 10, 2010}}</ref> *16 November - A USAF [[F-22A Raptor]], ''06-4125'', of the [[525th Fighter Squadron]], 3d Wing, crashes in [[Alaska]] near [[Susitna Lodge]], killing pilot Capt. Jeffrey Haney, from [[Clarklake, Michigan]].<ref name="Allport, Dave 2011, page 93">Allport, Dave, "''Accident Report''", Air Forces Monthly, Stamford, Lincs., UK, February 2011, Number 274, page 93.</ref><ref>http://www.f-22raptor.com/news_view.php?nid=423</ref> *20 November - Two people were taken to Pensacola Naval Hospital for evaluation after landing an Air Force [[T-6 Texan II]] with the landing gear up. The names of the two crew members were not released after the 1300 hrs. incident, [[Pensacola Naval Air Station]] Public Affairs Officer Harry White said. Both people safely exited the plane, which landed at [[Forrest Sherman Field]] at the air station, White said. The aircraft and crew are assigned to the U.S. Air Force's 455th Flying Training Squadron at NAS Pensacola. The incident is being investigated by a board of officers, a NAS Pensacola news release said.<ref>Pensacola, Florida, "''Two land Air Force plane with landing gear up, taken to hospital''", Pensacola News-Journal, 20 November 2010.</ref><ref>Allport, Dave, "''Accident Report''", Air Forces Monthly, February 2011, Number 274, page 93.</ref> *2 December - US Navy [[F/A-18C Hornet]], BuNo ''165184'', 'AD-351', suffers port [[undercarriage]] collapse on landing at [[NAF El Centro]], California, at 1615 hrs., and departs runway. The pilot ejects safely.<ref name="Allport, Dave 2011, page 93"/>
==2011== * 20 January - [[Ecuadorian Air Force]] [[De Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter]] ''FAE449'' crashed near Tena, Ecuador, all six on board killed.<ref name="scramble381-67">Scramble #381 p. 67</ref> * 2 February - An [[Indian Army]] Cheetah helicopter crashed at Nashik, western India, both crew killed.<ref name="scramble382-66">Scramble #382 p. 66</ref> * 8 February - A [[Royal Jordanian Air Force]] [[General Dynamics F-16|F-16AM]] crashed in central Jordan, pilot killed.<ref name="scramble382-67">Scramble #382 p. 67</ref> * 14 February - Two [[Royal Thai Air Force]] [[General Dynamics F-16]]s collide over north east Thailand, aircraft destroyed but both pilots ejected safely.<ref name="scramble382-68">Scramble #382 p. 68</ref> * 29 March - A US Marine [[Sikorsky CH-53 Sea Stallion]] crashed in [[Kaneohe Bay]], killing one and injuring three crewmembers.<ref>[[Associated Press]], "[http://www.navytimes.com/news/2011/04/ap-marine-investigators-raising-crashed-sea-stallion-helo-040611/ Investigators raising crashed Sea Stallion]", ''[[Military Times]]'', 6 April 2011.</ref> *30 March - Ten sailors are injured when an engine of an [[F/A-18C Hornet]] of [[VMFAT-101]] based at [[MCAS Miramar]], California,<ref>http://www.startribune.com/nation/118962469.html</ref> suffers a catastrophic failure while preparing for launch at 1450 hrs. during routine training exercises from the [[USS John C. Stennis|USS ''John C. Stennis'']], ~100 miles off the California coast. Five of the injured are taken by helicopter to the shore, four to the Naval Medical Center, [[San Diego]], and one to Scripps Institute at [[La Jolla]], California, said U.S. Navy Cmdr. Pauline Storum. None of the injuries were considered life threatening but the fighter sustained over $1 million damage. The ensuing fire was quickly extinguished and the carrier itself was not damaged.<ref>http://www.king5.com/home/Sailors-injured-after-explosion-on-USS-John-C-Stennis-118965909.html</ref> * 1 April - An [[A-10 Thunderbolt]] from [[Spangdahlem Air Base]] crashed near [[Laufeld]], Germany. The pilot, Lieutenant Colonel Scott Hurrelbrink, ejected and was not seriously injured.<ref>Kloeckner, Marcus, "[http://www.stripes.com/news/farmer-recalls-thunderbolt-ii-crash-pilot-s-concern-1.140008 Farmer recalls Thunderbolt II crash, pilot's concern]", ''[[Stars and Stripes (newspaper)|Stars and Stripes]]'', 4 April 2011, retrieved 6 April 2011.</ref> * 6 April - An [[VFA-122]] [[F/A-18E/F Super Hornet]] from [[Naval Air Station Lemoore]] crashed just outside the base, killing its two crewmembers.<ref>Guentes, Gidget, "[http://www.navytimes.com/news/2011/04/navy-lemoore-2-killed-in-hornet-crash-040611w/ 2 dead as F/A-18 goes down near Lemoore]", ''[[Military Times]]'', 6 April 2011.</ref><ref>Griswold, Lewis, and Eddie Jimenez, "Two Navy Officers Killed In NAS Lemoore Jet Crash", ''[[Fresno Bee]]'', 6 April 2011.</ref> *1 May - A two [[MH-60]] helicopter raid mounted from Afghanistan from [[Ghazi Airbase]]<ref name="nationaljournal.com">{{cite news|url=http://nationaljournal.com/whitehouse/the-secret-team-that-killed-bin-laden-20110502}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsmax.com/KenTimmerman/osamabinladen-seals-specialforces-pakistan/2011/05/02/id/394830|title=SEALs Sent to Kill bin Laden}}</ref> with 20-25 [[United States Navy SEALS]] on a [[Pakistan|Pakistani]] compound to capture or kill [[Osama bin Laden]] results in the death of the [[Al Quaeda]] leader. One helicopter, suffering mechanical failure after a hard landing when it reportedly struck the compound wall, is destroyed by the special operations force, with the team members departing on two [[CH-47 Chinook]]s<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/05/03/us-binladen-helicopter-idUSTRE7427G420110503 | work=Reuters | title=Helicopter loss in bin Laden raid highlights risks | date=3 May 2011}}</ref> with bin Laden's remains.<ref>http://blogs.abcnews.com/politicalpunch/2011/05/obama-gives-order-bin-laden-is-killed-white-house-time-line.html</ref> Both MH-60s were of the [[160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment]].<ref name="blogs.abcnews.com">{{cite news|url=http://blogs.abcnews.com/politicalpunch/2011/05/some-white-knuckle-moments-for-elite-navy-seals-team.html}}</ref> Subsequent reports state that the [[Sikorsky H-60 Blackhawk|Blackhawk]] helicopter destroyed was a previously unconfirmed, but rumored, [[Stealth technology|stealth]] modification of the design.<ref>Ross, Brian, Schwartz, Rhonda, Ferran, Lee, and Patel, Avni, "Top Secret Stealth Helicopter Program Revealed in Osama Bin Laden Raid: Experts", ABC World News, 4 May 2011.</ref><ref>http://abcnews.go.com/Blotter/top-secret-stealth-helicopter-program-revealed-osama-bin/story?id=13530693</ref> *13 June - The second test launch of the [[Boeing X-51|Boeing X-51 Waverider]] ends in failure off the Southern California coast when the vehicle fails to separate from its booster rocket after an air launch from an [[Edwards AFB]], California-based [[B-52 Stratofortress]]. Following the drop, the X-51 fell for about four seconds before its booster successfully ignited. The vehicle fell into the Pacific Ocean after the booster did not separate as intended. <ref>Associated Press, "2nd test flight of X-51 aircraft ends in crash," ''Air Force Times'', Saturday 18 June 2011.</ref> *19 July - A [[Royal Thai Army]] [[Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk]] helicopter crashed killing 9. The chopper had been sent out to recover five bodies of victims of another helicopter, a [[Bell UH-1 Iroquois]], that had crashed two days before while looking for illegal loggers over the [[Tenasserim Hills]] in the area between Myanmar and Thailand near [[Phetchaburi]].<ref>[http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/nationworld/2015692605_apasthailandhelicoptercrash.html?syndication=rss The Seattle Times]</ref> A third helicopter, a [[Bell 212]], also crashed in the same area on Sunday 25th July a few miles further east close to the Kaeng Krachan reservoir killing three.<ref>[http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/248732/copter-crashes-explained Bangkok Post - Helicopter crashes 'explained']</ref> Superstitious people blame the three consecutive crashes on the fact that the densely forested mountains of the Tenasserim Range have strong [[tutelary deity|guardian spirits]].<ref>[http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/248615/superstitions-haunt-forest Bangkok Post - Superstitions haunt forest]</ref> *28 July - A [[F-16 Fighting Falcon|General Dynamics F-16C Block 30H Fighting Falcon]], ''87-296'', c/n 5C-557, of the [[187th Fighter Wing]], [[Alabama Air National Guard]], out of [[Montgomery Air National Guard Base]], overruns runway at the [[Experimental Aircraft Association|EAA]] [[EAA AirVenture Oshkosh|AirVenture Oshkosh]] air show at [[Wittman Regional Airport]], [[Oshkosh, Wisconsin]], nose gear collapses, nose radome breaks, airframe skids to a stop. Pilot uninjured. <ref>http://abclocal.go.com/wls/story?section=news/local/wisconsin&id=8277786</ref><ref>http://www.fox6now.com/news/witi-20110728-eaa-f16-incident,0,628759.photogallery</ref> *20 August - A [[BAE Hawk]] of the RAF's [[Red Arrows]] aerobatic team crashed during a public display at [[Bournemouth Air Festival]], killing the pilot.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-14602900|title=Red Arrows pilot dies in Bournemouth Air Festival crash|date=20 August 2011|accessdate=20 August 2011|publisher=BBC|work=BBC News Online}}</ref> *2 September - A [[CASA C-212 Aviocar]] of the [[Chilean Air Force]] [[2011 Chilean Air Force CASA 212 crash|crashed into the sea]] off [[Robinson Crusoe Island]]. All 21 people on board were killed.
